snippet.textDisplay: I said last year when Lebron joined the lakers that he will have a rough first year and then pull the ole satanic sacrifice for power. With the voodoo magic of the warriors all getting hurt the exact same time Lebron can flourish. I never thought he would have sacrificed Kobe Bryant though. I also am wondering if Zion is the one who struck a deeal with the devil in order to come back from his knee the same time Kobe goes down. Lebron is on his way out but Zion is fresh demon blood for the powers that be. We shall see if Zion's attitude changes moving forward.

snippet.textDisplay: My condolences to all the families some included the Bryant family, NBA family, TNT family,  the rest of the family whose family members died(including Gianna Bryant), and any other family that Kobe considered his family and/or close friend! I met Shaq at Jamakingmecrazy Club in Orlando in 1995, he enthusiastically talked to me for a length of time about rapping while his friends patiently waited in his Superman truck. How passionate and sincerely that exchange was! So I teared a little not knowing Kobe but knowing that the reflecting from Shaq was from the depths of his big heart! You know what Ecclesiastes 7:1-4 says right? Better to go to the house of mourning(a funeral and such) because you can reflect as this team/family just did; but to use his example to help improve your life by meditating on his life stories and applying it in our everyday life and that's the best way to uphold anyone's legacy or life.
snippet.textOriginal: My condolences to all the families some included the Bryant family, NBA family, TNT family,  the rest of the family whose family members died(including Gianna Bryant), and any other family that Kobe considered his family and/or close friend! I met Shaq at Jamakingmecrazy Club in Orlando in 1995, he enthusiastically talked to me for a length of time about rapping while his friends patiently waited in his Superman truck. How passionate and sincerely that exchange was! So I teared a little not knowing Kobe but knowing that the reflecting from Shaq was from the depths of his big heart! You know what Ecclesiastes 7:1-4 says right? Better to go to the house of mourning(a funeral and such) because you can reflect as this team/family just did; but to use his example to help improve your life by meditating on his life stories and applying it in our everyday life and that's the best way to uphold anyone's legacy or life.

snippet.textDisplay:
"Mom, why do the best people die early?"

"When you're in a garden, which flower do you pluck first?"

"The most beautiful one."

"Your answer, son"


Maybe God was just jealous of having you among us. We'll miss you, Mamba. RIP Kobe and Gigi.

snippet.textDisplay: What a sad moment. I am a Lakers fan since the 80's. The magical 5 championship runs... And then... the long drought and  dry spell came.. 11 years  passed.. nada... finally the diesel and black mamba came to town and the ressurection begins, 3 consecutive NBA titles... then shaq left the building but kobe stayed and rebuilds... two more titles added to the trophy case... thanks Mr. Clutch, Jerry West for making Kobe a Laker. Thank you Kobe...rest in peace.. salute...

snippet.textDisplay:
With West fighting the tears, I can’t help but to let them out myself. As a lifetime Lakers fan, at the age of 45, this is the hardest thing I’ve had to endure as a sports fan in general. From Hershiser to Gretzky, Marcus Allen and Magic, just to mention a few, has no other LA sports icon been so deeply loved like Kobe. He was more than a Lakers player to us.

We will miss you, Kobe. R.I.P to you, your daughter Gigi, and the rest of the other passengers.

It’s not just West, but we Los Angelinos also, we’ll never get over your loss.
snippet.textOriginal:
With West fighting the tears, I can’t help but to let them out myself. As a lifetime Lakers fan, at the age of 45, this is the hardest thing I’ve had to endure as a sports fan in general. From Hershiser to Gretzky, Marcus Allen and Magic, just to mention a few, has no other LA sports icon been so deeply loved like Kobe. He was more than a Lakers player to us. 

We will miss you, Kobe. R.I.P to you, your daughter Gigi, and the rest of the other passengers. 

It’s not just West, but we Los Angelinos also, we’ll never get over your loss.

snippet.textDisplay:
I wrote this poem for Kobe Bryant, Gianna Bryant, John Altobelli, Keri Altobelli, Alyssa Altobelli, Christina Mauser, Sarah Chester, Payton Chester and Ara Zobayan. It will go in my next book of poetry. Rest easy, all.
Left to Wonder

Movement now accentuates the suddenness of agony
cooling faces of those left to suffer the wake of transition
We proffer exhaustion like drying riverbeds
no longer robust enough to encourage life

With sudden anguish a world hearkens
as heads turn to face your truth

Unabashed in utmost sorrow
a billion times the like
a world in agony crumbles to its knees


With far reach your arms embraced the world
affording unity only legs of indifference priorly lifted
Yet now there is but stillness
where grace once presided

How shall a world in strife coddle such grief
when it was you who held its contempt for so long
How shall we reconcile a life fallen short
when the length of your love knew no depth...
©2020 Steve Dupere
snippet.textOriginal:

Left to Wonder 

Movement now accentuates the suddenness of agony
cooling faces of those left to suffer the wake of transition
We proffer exhaustion like drying riverbeds
no longer robust enough to encourage life

With sudden anguish a world hearkens
as heads turn to face your truth

Unabashed in utmost sorrow
a billion times the like
a world in agony crumbles to its knees


With far reach your arms embraced the world 
affording unity only legs of indifference priorly lifted
Yet now there is but stillness
where grace once presided

How shall a world in strife coddle such grief
when it was you who held its contempt for so long
How shall we reconcile a life fallen short
when the length of your love knew no depth... 
©2020 Steve Dupere

snippet.textDisplay: I never was a laker fan or a kobe fan.  Never hated, had the utmost respect, but they just weren't my team.  That being said, this death hit me like a lightening bolt. I feel just like Jerry West does, i know one day i'll get over this one but i can't imagine it right now.

snippet.textDisplay: My daughter was born 2days before capri, Kobe's youngest. My daughters middle name is Gianna. I've actually met Kobe a few times while working in Memphis at the fedex forum where the Grizzlies play. I remember him shooting around early as he would occasionally do and I got brave enough to get as close as I could without getting in trouble with my supervisor. The ball bounced off the rim and I ran and grabbed it and passed him the ball. In which he made the next shot. No other player gave me chills like him and I've come across many stars during my time working at the fedex forum. This hurts basketball fans world wide. To think I felt the league lost a lot after his retirement and now he's gone from the world. I honestly think they should cancel games for the rest of the week because it's gonna be a long time for anyone to recover. And thinking about vanessa and her daughters.....it hurts just writing all this down
snippet.textOriginal: My daughter was born 2days before capri, Kobe's youngest. My daughters middle name is Gianna. snippet.textDisplay: I lost my favorite NBA player. His name was Kobe Bean Bryant. Kobe was selected 13th pick in the 1996 draft by the Charlotte Hornets(who later traded him to the Lakers). I remembered seeing his highlights. His energy, charisma, passion, devotion, commitment to the game never disappoints. He took the league by storm. When he scored 81 points against the raptors, that was when he became a superstar. When he won 5 titles with the lakers, He was a G.O.A.T in my eyes. He had 18 all-star appearances and made the all-star games even more fun when he would make these crazy dunks and shots. He won the all-star MVP 4 times. 4 times. When I announced that he was retiring, I started to feel sad. I remember his final all-star game with his final duel with Lebron. I remembered his countless duels with Lebron, Melo, Lillard, Harden, Durant, and more. He scored 60 points against the Utah Jazz. 60 points. I remembered him saying "Mamba out". Flashforward to January 26th, 2020. When my dad said to me "Kobe Bryant is dead", I thought he was joking. Little did I know he was serious. When I came downstairs, my face turned into a grim and shocked expression. My heart collapsed like a house of cards. To add on to the torment, His daughter, Gianna "Gigi" Bryant died with him on the helicopter crash as well as another family. That opened many wounds. Wounds that will never heal. Kobe, I will never forget what you did to me and the other children around the world. You've inspired so many other young NBA players. Rest in Peace, Kobe. You may be gone from this earth, but your legacy will never be forgotten. #Mamba4life #Gigi4life.
snippet.textOriginal: I lost my favorite NBA player. His name was Kobe Bean Bryant. Kobe was selected 13th pick in the 1996 draft by the Charlotte Hornets(who later traded him to the Lakers). I remembered seeing his highlights. His energy, charisma, passion, devotion, commitment to the game never disappoints. He took the league by storm. When he scored 81 points against the raptors, that was when he became a superstar. When he won 5 titles with the lakers, He was a G.O.A.T in my eyes. He had 18 all-star appearances and made the all-star games even more fun when he would make these crazy dunks and shots. He won the all-star MVP 4 times. 4 times. When I announced that he was retiring, I started to feel sad. I remember his final all-star game with his final duel with Lebron. I remembered his countless duels with Lebron, Melo, Lillard, Harden, Durant, and more. He scored 60 points against the Utah Jazz. 60 points. I remembered him saying "Mamba out". Flashforward to January 26th, 2020. When my dad said to me "Kobe Bryant is dead", I thought he was joking. Little did I know he was serious. When I came downstairs, my face turned into a grim and shocked expression. My heart collapsed like a house of cards. To add on to the torment, His daughter, Gianna "Gigi" Bryant died with him on the helicopter crash as well as another family. That opened many wounds. Wounds that will never heal. Kobe, I will never forget what you did to me and the other children around the world. You've inspired so many other young NBA players. Rest in Peace, Kobe. You may be gone from this earth, but your legacy will never be forgotten.  #Mamba4life  #Gigi4life.
